org.apache.juneau.assertions

Class FluentStringAssertion<R>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.juneau.assertions.Assertion
      • org.apache.juneau.assertions.FluentAssertion<R>
        • org.apache.juneau.assertions.FluentObjectAssertion<R>
          • org.apache.juneau.assertions.FluentStringAssertion<R>
  • Type Parameters:
    R - The return type.
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    StringAssertion

    public class FluentStringAssertion<R>
extends FluentObjectAssertion<R>
    Used for fluent assertion calls against strings.
    Example:

    // Validates the response body of an HTTP call is the text "OK". client .get(URL) .run() .assertBody().is("OK");

    • Constructor Summary

    • Method Detail

      • javaStrings

        public FluentStringAssertion<R> javaStrings()
        When enabled, text in the message is converted to valid Java strings.

        value.replaceAll("\\\\", "\\\\\\\\").replaceAll("\n", "\\\\n").replaceAll("\t", "\\\\t");

        Returns:
        This object (for method chaining).

      • isEqual

        public R isEqual(String value)
          throws AssertionError
        Asserts that the text equals the specified value.

        Similar to is(String) except error message states diff position.

        Example:

        // Validates the response body of an HTTP call is the text "OK". client .get(URL) .run() .assertBody().isEquals("OK");

        Parameters:
        value - The value to check against.
        If multiple values are specified, they are concatenated with newlines.
        Returns:
        The response object (for method chaining).
        Throws:
        AssertionError - If assertion failed.

      • isEqualLines

        public R isEqualLines(String... lines)
               throws AssertionError
        Asserts that the lines of text equals the specified value.
        Example:

        // Validates the response body of an HTTP call is the text "OK". client .get(URL) .run() .assertBody().isEqualLines( "Line 1", "Line 2", "Line 3" );

        Parameters:
        lines - The value to check against.
        If multiple values are specified, they are concatenated with newlines.
        Returns:
        The response object (for method chaining).
        Throws:
        AssertionError - If assertion failed.

      • isEqualSortedLines

        public R isEqualSortedLines(String... lines)
        Asserts that the text equals the specified value after splitting both by newlines and sorting the rows.
        Example:

        // Validates the response body of an HTTP call is the text "OK". client .get(URL) .run() .assertBody().isEqualSortedLines( "Line 1", "Line 2", "Line 3" );

        Parameters:
        lines - The value to check against.
        If multiple values are specified, they are concatenated with newlines.
        Returns:
        The response object (for method chaining).
        Throws:
        AssertionError - If assertion failed.

      • is

        public R is(String value)
     throws AssertionError
        Asserts that the text equals the specified value.

        Similar to isEqual(String) except error message doesn't state diff position.

        Example:

        // Validates the response body of an HTTP call is the text "OK". client .get(URL) .run() .assertBody().is("OK");

        Parameters:
        value - The value to check against.
        If multiple values are specified, they are concatenated with newlines.
        Returns:
        The response object (for method chaining).
        Throws:
        AssertionError - If assertion failed.

      • matchesSimple

        public R matchesSimple(String searchPattern)
                throws AssertionError
        Asserts that the text matches the specified pattern containing "*" meta characters.

        The "*" meta character can be used to represent zero or more characters..

        Parameters:
        searchPattern - The search pattern.
        Returns:
        The response object (for method chaining).
        Throws:
        AssertionError - If assertion failed.

      • msg

        public FluentStringAssertion<R> msg(String msg,
                                    Object... args)
        Description copied from class: Assertion
        Allows to to specify the assertion failure message.

        String can contain "{msg}" to represent the original message.

        Overrides:
        msg in class FluentObjectAssertion<R>
        Parameters:
        msg - The assertion failure message.
        args - Optional message arguments.
        Returns:
        This object (for method chaining).
